events.title: Message log
events.description: Updates LogText object with messages. For debugging

children.text:
This is similar to the chat example, but instead of keeping a log in a text box, we keep it in an ordinary Text object so we can see things behind it. However the text object cannot scroll its text, so instead we keep the last 20 messages in an array, and update the text object from that. This is a simple way to have the messages scroll up as more messages are added.

First when adding a log we add the line to the end of an array.
If we are over 20 messages, delete the first (oldest) message.
Reset the log text to empty - we will rebuild it completely from the array.
For each element will repeat for each chat log we've added in order, so we can append the message with a line break.

parameters: "Logged in with alias: " & Multiplayer.MyAlias & " (" & Multiplayer.MyID & ")" & newline & "Joining room..."
"Joined room as host, waiting for peer..."
"Kicked (either could not connect to host or host quit)"

parameters.text: Multiplayer.StatInboundCount & " in (" & (round(Multiplayer.StatInboundBandwidth/100)/10) & " k) / sec" & newline & Multiplayer.StatOutboundCount & " out (" & (round(Multiplayer.StatOutboundBandwidth/100)/10) & " k) / sec" & newline & "Host ping " & round(Multiplayer.PeerLatency(Multiplayer.HostID)) & ", PDV " & round(Multiplayer.PeerPDV(Multiplayer.HostID))
